channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: US Bombs 3 Nuclear Sites In Iran, Trump Says "Now Is Time For Peace"
item.description: President Donald Trump on Sunday said that the US has bombed three nuclear sites in Iran, joining Israel's war against Tehran.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/955709/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>President Donald Trump on Sunday said that the US has bombed three nuclear sites in Iran, joining Israel's war against Tehran.

item.title: US Moving B-2 Bombers To Guam Amid Middle East Tensions: Report

media:content.media:description: It was unclear whether the bomber deployment was tied to Middle East tensions.

item.description: The United States is moving B-2 bombers to the Pacific island of Guam, two US officials told Reuters on Saturday, as President Donald Trump weighs whether the United States should take part in Israel's strikes against Iran.
item.content:encoded: The United States is moving B-2 bombers to the Pacific island of Guam, two US officials told Reuters on Saturday, as President Donald Trump weighs whether the United States should take part in Israel's strikes against Iran.

item.title: Explained: Israel's Air Defence System Against Iranian Missiles

media:content.media:description: Israel and Iran have launched tit-for-tat attacks.

item.description: Israel and Iran launched fresh attacks at each other early on Saturday, with the conflict between the two regional foes showing no signs of slowing or ending.
item.content:encoded: Israel and Iran launched fresh attacks at each other early on Saturday, with the conflict between the two regional foes showing no signs of slowing or ending.

item.title: Iran's Khamenei, Living In Bunker, Names 3 Possible Successors: Report

media:content.media:description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is living in a deep bunker

item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has named three senior clerics as candidates to take his place if he is assassinated, The New York Times reported.
item.content:encoded: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has named three senior clerics as candidates to take his place if he is assassinated, The New York Times reported.

item.title: Russian Soldier Dies After Killing And Eating His Comrade To Survive Ukraine War: Report

media:content.media:description: 'Brelok', who killed his countryman 'Foma', was later found dead. (Representative pic)

item.description: A Russian soldier on the frontlines in Ukraine died after killing a comrade and eating his corpse in a desperate attempt to survive wartime conditions, according to the Kyiv Post.
item.content:encoded: A Russian soldier on the frontlines in Ukraine died after killing a comrade and eating his corpse in a desperate attempt to survive wartime conditions, according to the Kyiv Post.

item.title: Trump Says 'Mindbogglingly Historic' Deal With Harvard Will Be Announced Soon

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump signalled at a possible "deal" between the administration and Harvard

item.description: Earlier, the president had accused Harvard of failing to clamp down and perpetuating antisemitism. He had terminated $2 billion in grants and also tried to ban the school from granting admission to international students.
item.content:encoded: Earlier, the president had accused Harvard of failing to clamp down and perpetuating antisemitism. He had terminated $2 billion in grants and also tried to ban the school from granting admission to international students.

item.title: "It Is Doing Wonders": Pak Defence Minister Praises Civil-Military "Hybrid Model"

media:content.media:description: Khwaja Asif described the civil-military hybrid system as co-ownership of the power structure.

item.description: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif and a close aide of ruling PML-N president and former prime minister Nawaz Sharif said the country is being governed under a "hybrid model" in which the military enjoys a major power share.
item.content:encoded: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif and a close aide of ruling PML-N president and former prime minister Nawaz Sharif said the country is being governed under a "hybrid model" in which the military enjoys a major power share.

item.title: On Camera, 8 Killed In Hot Air Balloon Horror In Brazil

media:content.media:description: Thirteen survivors were transported to nearby hospitals.

item.description: At least eight people were killed after a hot-air balloon carrying 21 passengers crashed on Saturday in Brazil's southern state of Santa Catarina, local and state officials said.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/955628/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>At least eight people were killed after a hot-air balloon carrying 21 passengers crashed on Saturday in Brazil's southern state of Santa Catarina, local and state officials said.

item.title: India Assures Nepal Of Evacuating Its Citizens From Conflict-Hit Iran

media:content.media:description: Of the 16 Nepali nationals, five are currently in Iranian prisons. (Representational)

item.description: India on Saturday assured Nepal that it will evacuate its nationals currently stranded in Iran amid its conflict with Israel.
item.content:encoded: India on Saturday assured Nepal that it will evacuate its nationals currently stranded in Iran amid its conflict with Israel.

item.title: Colombian "She Hulk" Beaten To Death With Hammer, Husband Found Dead With "Self-Inflicted Wounds"

media:content.media:description: Cops found Ms Mendez with injuries indicating she had been killed with a hammer.

item.description: A 43-year-old Colombian bodybuilder known as "She Hulk" was found beaten to death with a hammer, and her husband was also discovered dead with self-inflicted knife wounds.
item.content:encoded: A 43-year-old Colombian bodybuilder known as "She Hulk" was found beaten to death with a hammer, and her husband was also discovered dead with self-inflicted knife wounds.

item.title: Israel Strikes Iran's Isfahan Nuclear Facility Again As Conflict Escalates

media:content.media:description: The aftermath of Israeli strikes on Iran's Isfahan nuclear facility

item.description: According to the Israel Defence Forces (IDF), around 50 fighter jets were involved in bombing Iranian positions. However, Iranian state-affiliated Fars news agency reported that no hazardous material leakage occurred.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/955607/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>According to the Israel Defence Forces (IDF), around 50 fighter jets were involved in bombing Iranian positions. However, Iranian state-affiliated Fars news agency reported that no hazardous material leakage occurred.

item.title: Korean Pool Sparks Outrage Over Shocking Sign Linking Low Income To Poor Hygiene: Report

media:content.media:description: The controversial pool sign went viral online, sparking outrage over its guidelines.

item.description: A privately run swimming facility in South Korea sparked outrage after posting a notice implying that low-income individuals are less hygienic.
item.content:encoded: A privately run swimming facility in South Korea sparked outrage after posting a notice implying that low-income individuals are less hygienic.

item.title: Donald Trump's Youngest Son, Barron, May Have Earned $40 Million From Family's Crypto Venture: Report

media:content.media:description: Barron Trump is listed as a "co-founder" of World Liberty Financial.

item.description: Barron Trump, the youngest child of US President Donald Trump, may have earned close to $40 million - $25 million after taxes - from the sale of crypto tokens linked to the family's crypto venture named World Liberty Financial, according to Forbes.
item.content:encoded: Barron Trump, the youngest child of US President Donald Trump, may have earned close to $40 million - $25 million after taxes - from the sale of crypto tokens linked to the family's crypto venture named World Liberty Financial, according to Forbes.

item.title: 'Gwada Negative': Woman From Caribbean Island Only Carrier Of New Blood Type

media:content.media:description: The scientific association had until now recognised 47 blood group systems. (Representational)

item.description: A French woman from the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe has been identified as the only known carrier of a new blood type, dubbed "Gwada negative," France's blood supply agency has announced.
item.content:encoded: A French woman from the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe has been identified as the only known carrier of a new blood type, dubbed "Gwada negative," France's blood supply agency has announced.

item.title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 5.1 Hits Iran, Sparks Theories Of Nuclear Testing

media:content.media:description: A powerful earthquake of 5.1 magnitude struck northern Iran's Semnan area

item.description: The earthquake has now triggered a wave of speculations about whether Tehran has tested a nuclear weapon. It has also sparked concern because it struck near a city with a space and missile complex.
item.content:encoded: The earthquake has now triggered a wave of speculations about whether Tehran has tested a nuclear weapon. It has also sparked concern because it struck near a city with a space and missile complex.

item.title: Brazil Prisoner's Desperate Escape Attempt Leaves Him Stuck In Prison Wall

media:content.media:description: The prisoner sustained minor injuries and was rescued unharmed.

item.description: In Brazil, an inmates escape attempt went wrong when he got stuck in a prison wall. Firefighters had to drill him out safely after wardens spotted strange movement.
item.content:encoded: In Brazil, an inmates escape attempt went wrong when he got stuck in a prison wall. Firefighters had to drill him out safely after wardens spotted strange movement.

item.title: Venice Divided Ahead Of Jeff Bezos-Laura Sanchez's 'Wedding Of The Century'

media:content.media:description: Many details of the wedding are still under wraps - including the precise day it will happen.

item.description: Venice is divided ahead of next week's celebrity wedding of US tech-tycoon Jeff Bezos and Laura Sanchez, with some looking forward to the glitz and glamour, while others fear it will turn the scenic city of gondolas and palazzi into an amusement park
item.content:encoded: Venice is divided ahead of next week's celebrity wedding of US tech-tycoon Jeff Bezos and Laura Sanchez, with some looking forward to the glitz and glamour, while others fear it will turn the scenic city of gondolas and palazzi into an amusement park

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard's Clarification On Iran After Trump's 2nd Rebuke In A Week

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump and spy chief Tulsi Gabbard.

item.description: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard on Saturday said the US believes that Iran could have a nuclear weapon built "within weeks to months", hours after she was snubbed by President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard on Saturday said the US believes that Iran could have a nuclear weapon built "within weeks to months", hours after she was snubbed by President Donald Trump.

item.title: Indian Workers In Israel Being Forced To Return? What Government Said

media:content.media:description: Last week, the embassy asked all Indians in Israel to stay vigilant. (Representational)

item.description: The government, putting an end to rumours, said that no Indian workers in Israel would be forced to return to their home country.
item.content:encoded: The government, putting an end to rumours, said that no Indian workers in Israel would be forced to return to their home country.

item.title: UK Woman, 59, Dies Of Rabies After Getting "Slightly" Scratched By Stray Puppy In Morocco

media:content.media:description: Yvonne Ford, from South Yorkshire, died on June 11. (Representative pic)

item.description: A 59-year-old British woman has died of rabies after getting "scratched" by a stray puppy in Morocco, the BBC reported.
item.content:encoded: A 59-year-old British woman has died of rabies after getting "scratched" by a stray puppy in Morocco, the BBC reported.
